character_name: Frodo Baggins: A young hobbit who inherits the One Ring from his uncle Bilbo. Wood was the first actor to be cast on 7 July 1999.[10] Wood was a fan of the book
Gandalf the Grey: An Istari wizard and mentor to Frodo. Sean Connery was approached for the role
Aragorn "Strider" Elessar II: A Dúnedain ranger and heir to Gondor's throne. Daniel Day-Lewis was offered the part at the beginning of pre-production
Samwise Gamgee: Better known as Sam
Boromir: A son of the Stewards of Gondor who journeys with the Fellowship towards Mordor. Bruce Willis
Peregrin Took: Better known as Pippin
Meriadoc Brandybuck: Better known as Merry
Gimli: A dwarf warrior who accompanies the Fellowship to Mordor after they set out from Rivendell. Billy Connolly
Legolas Greenleaf: A prince of the elves' Woodland Realm and a skilled archer. Bloom initially auditioned for Faramir
Arwen Undómiel: An elf of Rivendell and Aragorn's lover. The filmmakers approached Tyler after seeing her performance in Plunkett & Macleane
Galadriel: The elven co-ruler of Lothlórien alongside her husband Celeborn. Lucy Lawless was considered for the role.[22]
Saruman the White: The fallen head of the Istari Order who succumbs to Sauron's will through his use of the palantír. Lee was a major fan of the book
Elrond: The Elven-Lord of Rivendell who leads the Council of Elrond
Bilbo Baggins: Frodo's uncle who gives him the Ring after he decides to retire to Rivendell. Holm previously played Frodo in a 1981 radio adaption of The Lord of the Rings
Gollum (voice/motion capture): A wretched hobbit-like creature whose mind was poisoned by the Ring after bearing it for centuries. This character appears briefly in the prologue. In Mordor
Sauron the Deceiver: The Dark Lord of Mordor and the One Ring's true master who manifests as an Eye after the destruction of his physical form.
Celeborn the Wise: The Elven-Lord of Lothlórien and Galadriel's husband.
Lurtz: The commander of Saruman's Uruk-Hai forces.
Haldir: The leader of the Galadhrim warriors guarding the border of Lothlórien.
Ereinion Gil-galad: The last Elven-King of Noldor.
Elendil the Tall: The last High King of Arnor and Gondor.
Isildur: Elendil's son and Aragorn's ancestor who originally defeated Sauron.
